chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant David Henry Barnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and asessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assesment. Comply with recommended treatment.

No drugs.
No contact with J.M.G., her family.  No contact with the biological child until the age of 21, and only if child wishes to have contact.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay mandatory surcharges. 
Court advised defendant he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
Court advised defenasnt that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Henry Barnes in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant David Henry Barnes in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 45 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 75 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with JMG, her family.  No contact with the biological child until the age of 21 and only if child wishes to have contact
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges
*Pay child support

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

CASE RECALLED IN THE A.M.......SAME APPEARANCES.....

Amended Information filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended information.  On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 amended to 1st DEGREE CHILD SEXUAL ASSAULT- SEXUAL CONTACT WITH A CHILD UDER AGE 13, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(1)(e), 393.50(3)(b), a Class B Felony.  Count 1 REMAINS THE SAME.  

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, Body armor possession, and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to negotiations and on state's motion , the Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 2.


AS TO UNCHARGED OFFENSES:  Pursuant to negotiations the state agrees not to charge intimidation of a witness or additional sex acts (specifics set forth on the record) but the same to be read-in for the purpose of sentencing in Count 2.


The Court reiterates to the defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect.  The Court orders the defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Henry Barnes in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant David Henry Barnes in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  Defendant requesting new counsel.  Statements made by defense and defendant.  The Court denies motion.  Defense renews motion to withdraw.  The Court makes inquiry of defendant.  Defendant is no longer seeking new counsel.  Defense in contest posture.  Pre-trial issues addressed with the parties.  Parties request time to engage in negotiations.  Case passed until 1:30 p.m.

to Rescind the Defendant's Communication Privileges filed.
jad

Attorney Lori A. Kuehn in court, defendant David Henry Barnes not in court, in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Henry Barnes in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant David Henry Barnes in custody. Kevin Shomin for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, NOTICE OF MOITON AND MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL FOR THE DEFENDANT.

Defendant David Henry Barnes in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant David Henry Barnes in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMB (5/12/02); HER FRIEND JD; JESSICA K. AND FAMILY; ANY CHILDREN UNDER 17 OTHER RELEASE CONDITIONS:  GPS MONITORING.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant David Henry Barnes in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant David Henry Barnes in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERED DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
